docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: I REMEMBER how my happy baby used to conduct imaginary orchestras with asparagus spears as her batons, how she pruned tiny broccoli trees proudly with her two teeth, and how she gummed cold chunks of apples to ease the pain of teething.
docs.snippet: LEAD: I REMEMBER how my happy baby used to conduct imaginary orchestras with asparagus spears as her batons, how she pruned tiny broccoli trees proudly with her two teeth, and how she gummed cold chunks of apples to ease the pain of teething.

byline.original: By Karen S. Daugherty; Karen S. Daugherty lives in Greenwich

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: HEADACHES ARE A-mong the five most frequent complaints brought to a family doctor - but no two people describe them in quite the same way. Nor are two doctors likely to interpret those complaints in the same way. So it's not hard to see why misdiagnoses are common and why they lead to failed treatments.

byline.original: BY BRUCE H. DOBKIN, M.D.:Bruce H. Dobkin is associate clinical professor of neurology at the University of California at Los Angeles

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: There was another skirmish today in the battle between the Administration and Congress over the surtax many older Americans are paying for extended benefits under the Medicare program. Congressional economists project a large surplus, while the Administration, in a new study, projects a large deficit.

headline.main: BENTSEN AND BUSH CLASH ON SURTAX

byline.original: By MARTIN TOLCHIN; Special to The New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The last two decades have seen a dramatic improvement in the ability to prevent and treat life-threatening heart disease. Changes in living habits, like eating less fat, stopping smoking and getting more exercise, are stemming the epidemic of coronary deaths. And the lives of those already afflicted with heart disease are being prolonged by coronary care units, pacemakers, bypass surgery and drugs that stimulate the heart, thin the blood and lower cholesterol and blood pressure.

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The mother of a baby whose death was linked to her cocaine abuse in pregnancy has been charged with involuntary manslaughter.

headline.main: Mother Charged After Her Baby Dies of Cocaine

docs.snippet: LEAD: The mother of a baby whose death was linked to her cocaine abuse in pregnancy has been charged with involuntary manslaughter.

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Several medical experts and a Federal health official testified today that a drug company's program to educate doctors and young women about the risks of severe birth defects from the anti-acne drug Accutane was inadequate.

headline.main: Hearings Are Held On Acne Drug Dangers

docs.snippet: LEAD: Several medical experts and a Federal health official testified today that a drug company's program to educate doctors and young women about the risks of severe birth defects from the anti-acne drug Accutane was inadequate.

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Facing at least $5 billion in employee medical costs this year, many automobile industry executives acknowledge that their efforts to control costs have failed, and they are calling for drastic changes in the way the nation pays for health care.
